Terms and Conditions for Using the Therapy AI Application
Last Updated: May 25, 2025
Welcome to Therapy AI, an advanced platform for managing, documenting, and analysing therapy sessions using artificial intelligence technologies. Please read the following terms of use carefully. Use of the application constitutes full and explicit agreement to these terms.

1. Definitions
•	“The Application” – The Therapy AI platform, including all services, interfaces, content, modules, and features it provides.
•	“The User” – A certified therapist authorized to use the system for therapeutic purposes.
•	“The Operator” – The company that develops, owns, and is responsible for maintaining and operating the application.

2. Terms of Use
•	Use of the application is permitted only for certified therapists who hold a valid license to practice psychological, psychotherapeutic, or clinical therapy.
•	Login credentials and access to the system must not be shared or transferred to others.
•	The user agrees to use the application in accordance with applicable laws, including the Privacy Protection Law, the Care of the Mentally Impaired Act, and relevant institutional professional guidelines.

3. Privacy and Data Security
•	Data collected through the application is stored securely in the cloud (Azure Cosmos DB), in compliance with strict information security standards such as ISO/IEC 27001.
•	Personal or clinical data will not be shared with third parties without the patient’s explicit written consent, unless required by law.
HIPAA Compliance (USA):
•	If services are provided within the United States or to entities subject to U.S. regulation, the application complies with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) regarding the protection and privacy of medical information (PHI).
•	The system includes encryption mechanisms, access controls, data separation, and activity logging to ensure full legal compliance.
•	Therapists subject to HIPAA may sign a Business Associate Agreement (BAA) with the operator upon request.

4. Liability and Limitation of Liability
•	The application is provided as-is, without any express or implied warranties.
•	The operator shall not be held liable for any direct or indirect damages resulting from the use of the application.

5. Intellectual Property
•	All copyrights, trademarks, code, and content included in the application are the exclusive property of the operator or its licensors.
•	It is prohibited to copy, reproduce, transmit, distribute, publish, or use the app’s content for commercial purposes without prior written approval from the operator.

6. Changes to the Terms
•	The operator reserves the right to update these terms of use at any time.
•	Updated terms will be published within the app, and continued use will constitute renewed consent to the revised terms.

7. Legal Guardianship and Valid Consent
•	If the patient is a minor (under 18), legally protected, or lacks legal capacity, use of the application—including session recording—requires a signed consent from the legal guardian.
•	The guardian must present official documentation such as a court appointment or legal authorization.
•	Without valid consent, access to the app will be denied, and the operator reserves the right to block or delete the associated account.
•	Any use of the system without valid legal consent is the sole responsibility of the user.

8. User Responsibility for Credential Security
•	The user is responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of their login details (username, password, authentication methods).
•	It is strictly prohibited to share access with any third party, including other therapists or unauthorized staff. Any activity conducted under the user’s account will be deemed to have been performed by them, unless the operator is notified in writing of suspected unauthorized access.


9. Transparency and Permission Management – Patient Data Rights
To improve service quality, the application collects and analyses the following information during use:
•	Audio recordings of sessions
•	Automatic transcriptions
•	Sentence-level sentiment analysis
•	Basic profile information (e.g., age, gender, login date)
Access to this information is available to:
•	The patient (via the personal area in the app)
•	The direct therapist
•	A supervisor therapist (with explicit approval only)
Patients are entitled to:
•	View their transcripts
•	Submit requests to correct or delete specific sections, subject to professional approval

Informed Consent for Recording a Therapy Session upon QR Scan by the Patient
Last Updated: May 25, 2025
To ensure transparency, privacy, and clinical accountability, your participation in a therapy session via the Therapy AI application constitutes informed consent for recording the session, in accordance with the following terms:

1. Purpose of the Recording
The system records the audio session between the patient and the therapist for the purposes of:
•	Automatic transcription of the conversation
•	Sentiment analysis performed using artificial intelligence
•	Enhancing the quality of care and enabling continuous clinical follow-up

2. Use of Information
•	The recording will be used solely for therapeutic and professional purposes.
•	The information will not be shared with external parties or used for any non-therapeutic purpose, unless required by law or with the explicit consent of the patient.

3. Retention and Deletion Policy
•	The recording will be securely stored for up to 12 months from the date of recording, unless the therapist explicitly requests to retain it for additional therapeutic needs.
•	Upon the end of the retention period, the recording will be securely deleted with no option for recovery, unless there is a legal or clinical obligation to retain it.

4. Data Security and Access
•	All recordings and personal data are stored in a secure cloud environment that complies with strict information security standards such as ISO 27001.
•	Access to the data is restricted to:
	The patient’s direct therapist
	The patient themselves
	A certified supervisor therapist, if required for therapeutic purposes only
•	All access is logged and subject to strict permission controls.


5. Transparency and Access Rights – Patient Data Rights
To improve service quality, the application collects and analyses the following information during use:
•	Audio recordings of the session
•	Automatic transcriptions
•	Sentence-level sentiment analysis
•	Basic profile information (e.g., age, gender, login date)
Access to this information is available to:
•	The patient (via their personal area in the app)
•	The direct therapist
•	A supervisor therapist (with explicit approval)
The patient has the right to:
•	View the transcript
•	Request corrections or deletions of specific sections, subject to professional approval

6. Patient Rights
•	Consent is given voluntarily and may be revoked at any time by directly contacting the therapist.
•	Upon withdrawal of consent, the deletion of the recording will be considered in accordance with the law and professional judgment.

7. Legal Guardianship
•	If the patient is a minor, legally protected, or has a court-appointed guardian, a signed consent form from the legal guardian along with appropriate documentation must be provided.
•	Without proper documentation, participation in the session through the app will not be permitted.


8. Use of the System in Emergency Situations
•	The application is not a substitute for emergency medical care or immediate psychiatric assistance.
•	In cases of severe emotional distress, imminent danger, or the need for urgent intervention, patients must contact appropriate authorities such as a medical centre, emergency room, or mental health crisis line.
•	The responsibility to seek external help when needed lies solely with the patient.

9. Signature and Digital Consent Documentation
Informed consent for recording and documentation is given by scanning a unique QR code before the session begins.
Upon scanning, a summary screen will appear, prompting the patient to explicitly confirm the terms. This action will be digitally logged and stored as a binding electronic signature.
The system maintains a signed record of the consent, including a timestamp, user identifier, and technical identifiers such as IP address or device ID.

10. Contact
The application has not yet been deployed, and therefore no official contact email is currently available. A dedicated support email will be provided once the application is officially launched and its owners assume operational responsibility.
